etomica.space1d

Class Space1D

  • java.lang.Object
    • etomica.space.Space
      • etomica.space1d.Space1D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISpace, java.io.Serializable

    public final class Space1D
extends Space
    Factory and methods appropriate to a 1-dimensional space. This is a singleton class that can be accessed only via the static getInstance method.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Returns the Dth root of the given value, a^(1/D), where D is the dimension of the space.

      • sphereVolume

        public double sphereVolume(double r)
        Description copied from interface: ISpace
        Returns the "volume" of the "sphere" defined in the D-dimensional space. In 1-D, this is twice the radius; in 2-D the area of the circle; in 3-D the volume of the sphere.
        Specified by:
        sphereVolume in interface ISpace
        Specified by:
        sphereVolume in class Space
        Parameters:
        r - the radius
        Returns:
        the volume

      • sphereArea

        public double sphereArea(double r)
        Description copied from interface: ISpace
        Returns the surface "area" of the "sphere" defined in the D-dimensional space. In 1-D this is zero; in 2-D the circumference of the circle; in 3-D the surface area of the sphere.
        Specified by:
        sphereArea in interface ISpace
        Specified by:
        sphereArea in class Space
        Parameters:
        r - the radius
        Returns:
        the area

      • r2

        public static final double r2(Vector1D u1,
                              Vector1D u2,
                              IBoundary b)
        Computes the square of the magnitude of the difference of two vectors, subject to a nearest image transformation. This method constructs a new vector that is used as the work-vector input to the other r2 method.

      • r2

        public static final double r2(Vector1D u1,
                              Vector1D u2,
                              IBoundary b,
                              Vector1D work)
        Computes the square of the magnitude of the difference of two vectors, subject to a nearest image transformation.
        Parameters:
        u1 - one of the vectors and is unchanged by the calculation
        u2 - the other vector and is unchanged by the calculation
        b - a nearest image transformation
        work - a work vector used for the calculation.
